intro: Mentzelia sericea, commonly known as silky mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Mentzelia sericea is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native range.
